description.narrative: For 2019, the Ministry of Education, certified territorial entities and local authorities in priority municipalities will improve their capacity to offer learning environments adapted to the cultural particularities of indigenous and Afro-descendant children and teenagers in order to obtain better educational results, which contributes to Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Evaluation And Research, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes, Learning Outcomes (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2019, girls, boys and adolescents including those from conflict affected areas access and stay in an equitable, inclusive and quality education system that contributes to a sustainable peace and reconciliation process

sector.narrative: Evaluation innovation learning, uptake and partnerships for evaluation
System strengthening - mother tongue / multilingual education

title.narrative: Colombia United Nations Development Assistance Framework
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: For 2019, the Ministry of Education, certified territorial entities and local authorities in priority municipalities will improve their capacity to offer learning environments adapted to the cultural particularities of indigenous and Afro-descendant children and teenagers in order to obtain better educational results

description.narrative: Through the Ethno-Education Strategy, UNICEF provides the Ministry of Education with a conceptual, methodological and operational roadmap to update national ethno-education guidelines that respond to the particular cultural and educational aspects of indigenous and Afro-descendant children and adolescents. | Status:Met | As-of Date:23/01/2020

title.narrative: Service Delivery - Schools with school development plans that explicitly address equity issues and that were developed with UNICEF support

target.value: 2020:The plan implemented in 30% of the departments prioritized by UNICEF

actual.value: 2018:The secretariats of education focused by UNICEF incorporate ethnoeducation actions in the local education sector plan

title.narrative: Percentage of principals and teachers in territories targeted by UNICEF who incorporate pedagogical practices in the framework of Community Educational Projects (PEC) for developing learning processes in indigenous and Afro-descendant children and teenagers.
Percentage of indigenous and Afro-descendant children and teenagers who access new learning opportunities in the framework of adjusted Community Educational Projects.

target.value: 2019:Increase by 70 per cent in indigenous and Afro-descendant children and teenagers from target territories who access new learning opportunities in the framework of adjusted Community Educational Projec
